title: Approaches to Clinical Signs and Symptoms(Paediatrics)
description:
This module emphasis on clinical approaches for the common clinical symptoms, signs and abnormal laboratory results. Students can utilise the knowledge and skills learnt from advanced health assessment and pathophysiology to identify the common causes of the presented clinical
problems, as well as to recognise the “red flag” during the evaluation and initiate the appropriate immediate investigations and specific managements.
department: Alice Lee Center for Nursing Studies
faculty: Yong Loo Lin Sch of Medicine
prerequisite:
NUR5601 Advanced Health Assessment (Paediatrics)
NUR5602 Applied Pathophysiology (Paediatrics)
